Class PlayerMatController

  • java.lang.Object
    • viewmodels.PlayerMatController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IController
    public class PlayerMatController
extends java.lang.Object
implements IController
    This class has full control over the playermat views. It is responsible for showing the playerÂ´s own icon, the upgrade playerHand and tbe register of the player.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()

      • initializeCards

        public void initializeCards​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> deck)
        This method is called when the protocol "YouCards" is called. YourCards gives the DrawDeck which is utilised here to fill the PopUp-Window. This method fulfills two functions: first, all the hboxes are made responsive, second the drag and drop method is envocked
        Parameters:
        deck - : The playerHand one draws for choosing their programming

      • emptyHand

        public void emptyHand()
        This method removes the cards of the player hand when the player has dragged five cards into the register.

      • getEmptyRegisterNumbers

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getEmptyRegisterNumbers()
        This method return an arraylIst with all currently empty registers It is used in handleTimerFinished for filling up registers that have not yet been filled
        Returns:

      • putImageInRegister

        public void putImageInRegister​(int registerNumber,
                               javafx.scene.image.Image cardImage)
        This method sets registers individually with an image of a programming card. It is used when the timer finishes so that the remaining registers can be filled.
        Parameters:
        registerNumber -
        cardImage -

        public void loadCards​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardsInHand)
        This method loads the right colored cards into the players hand according to which robot the player has chosen
        Parameters:
        cardsInHand - The nine cards in the players hand
